p.em: Below are 4 properties of gold. Which are physical properties? Check all that apply.

multiple_choice.choice: Pure gold is a vibrant yellow color, while fool's gold is darker yellow.
The density of gold is 19.3 g/mL, whereas the density of fool's gold is 5.02 g/mL
Gold will not react with nitric acid, but most other metals will.
Gold is relatively soft and malleable, but fool's gold is brittle.

response.feedback: Correct. Physical properties can be observed without chemically changing the substance.
Incorrect. Fill in the blanks in the activity below and try again.

fill_in_the_blank.choice: can be observed without chemically altering the substance.
can NOT be observed without chemically altering the substance.
can be observed without chemically altering the substance.
can NOT be observed without chemically altering the substance.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The color, density, and malleability of a substance can all be observed without chemically altering the substance. These are all physical properites. To observed the reactivity of a substance with acid requires that the substance be chemically altered. Reactivity with nitric acid is a chemical property.

Correct. The color, density, and malleability of a substance can all be observed without chemically altering the substance. These are all physical properites. To observed the reactivity of a substance with acid requires that the substance be chemically altered. Reactivity with nitric acid is a chemical property.

question.body: For the following equation, write the complete ionic equation on your own paper, identify the spectator ions and then choose the correct net ionic equation from the choices below. $$\mathrm{Zn}(s)\;+\;2\;{\mathrm{AgNO}}_3(aq)\;\rightarrow\;\mathrm{Zn}({\mathrm{NO}}_3)_2(aq)\;+\;2\;\mathrm{Ag}(s)$$

response.feedback: Correct. The NO3− ion is the spectator ion in this equation.
Incorrect. The zinc ion has a charge of 2+, Zn2+, and the silver ion has a charge of 1+, Ag1+.
Incorrect. The NO3− ion is the spectator ion and should be removed from both sides of the equation.
Incorrect. The silver and zinc only exist as ions when in aqueous solution. The solid forms are not ions and should not be represented as such in the equation.
